gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
Dataset of administrative boundaries on country level
This dataset contains 3 feature classes (regions, boundaries) per scale level and there are 6 different scale levels (100K, 1M, 3M, 10M, 20M and 60M). In addition to those 12 feature classes, there is an additional scale independent feature class for the labels and the Capital Cities of the World. The extent of the feature classes covers the entire world.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The countries data set is used mainly for mapping purposes.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Directive 20007/.../EC/ of the European parliament and of the Council of establishing an Infrastructure for Spatial Information in the European Community (INSPIRE)

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: The datasets have been created for cartographic purposes.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: All feature classes, attribute tables and relationship classes should be present

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: All feature classes, attribute tables and relationship classes are present

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency of CNTR region feature class for all scales

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR regions should not overlap each other

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No topology errors identified, so no overlapping regions.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency of CNTR boundary feature class for all scales

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR boundaries must not have dangles, must not overlap, must have not pseudonodes, must not self-overlap, must not self-intersect, must not intersect or touch interior and must be singlepart

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No real topology errors identified. See QC report.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency between CNTR regions and CNTR boundaries for all scales

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR_BN_2010: Must be covered by boundary of CNTR_RG_2010
CNTR_LB_2010: Must be properly inside a polygon in CNTR_RG_nnM_2010 with the same CNTR_ID

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No real errors found, all indicated labels outside a region belonged to archipelagos

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency of CNTR Capitals of the World

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR_CAPT_PT_2010 must be properly inside a polygon in CNTR_RG_nnM_2010

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No real topology errors identified. See QC report.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The integrity and cardinality of the relationships (conceptual and implemented) was checked by enforcing primary and foreign key integrity constraints in Oracle. The constraints referencing coded value domain tables were a test of domain consistency.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Errors will show during creation of integrity constraints in Oracle. Constraints will not be applicable in case of violations to the consistency.

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No errors occurred, so the integrity of all primary and foreign keys was confirmed. All the values of each coded value attribute are compliant to the domains (except for any NULL values). The cardinality can only be confirmed where it is strict enough for this test to detect errors.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency between CNTR regions and CNTR boundaries for all scales

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: CNTR_RG_nnM_2010: Boundary must be covered by CNTR_BN_nnM_2010

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No real topology errors identified. See QC report.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: This dataset (together with the other datasets: NUTS_2010, CNTR_2010, COMM_2010, EEZ_2010 and COAS_2010) is based on geometry of EBM_v5 of EuroGeographics on commune level with a resolution of 30m (scale 1:100.000) enriched with some other datasources like Gaul 2008 country data and ArcWorld data. This resulted in a common repository of geometry of which the different datasets were derived. The different scale levels were derived of generalizations of the common repository on 100K scale. This means that within each scale level the feature classes of all these datasets: COMM_2010, NUTS_2010, CNTR_2010 and COAS_2010, are fully coherent and compliant. Each scale level in the CNTR_2010 dataset consists of 2 feature classes (regions and boundaries) The boundaries and regions are related to each other through a relationship table. In addition to the region and boundary feature classes there is also 1 label feature class which is scale independent and the Capitals of the World, data source from Esri datasets. For each CNTR in the region feature class there is exactly 1 label .

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: (i) Eurogeographics EBM v5.0. and GRO SCOTLAND DATA data (scale 1:100K) (ii) GAUL 2008 country level data (iii) TR for the Turkish features FROM GISCO data 2006 (vi) VLIZ Maritime Boundaries Geodatabase Economic Exclusive Zones (EEZ)
